alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cascade County through 415 PM MDT... At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Great Falls, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail and brief heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Black Eagle, Ulm, Malmstrom Afb, Sand Coulee, Tracy, Centerville, and First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
